page.title: 12COMBE FLOREY
page.content:
Four miles west of the A358 is Combe Florey. The village is remarkable for its small sandstone church which stands near the centre of the village.
The church dates from c.1300 in its oldest part, the north aisle. The Norman-French inscription recording the heart burial of Dame Maud de Meriet, a nun of Cannington and the adjoining tomb of a knight and two ladies has produced a local story that she was the wife of Sir John de Meriet of Hestercombe ( d.1327 ) and that his attempt to get hold of his wife's heart for burial outside the nunnery led to his excommunication. { {
